title: Rocc (opera stage director)
text:
Rocc (born Rok Rappl; 14 December 1979) is a Slovenian-born <a href="opera">opera</a> <a href="Theatre%20director">stage director</a>, <a href="scenographer">scenographer</a>, <a href="dramaturge">dramaturge</a>, <a href="Performance%20art">performance artist</a>, <a href="Opera%20management">opera manager</a> and <a href="Pedagogy">pedagogue</a>. His professional <a href="Mononymous%20person">mononymous</a> <a href="pseudonym">pseudonym</a> is a tribute to , Rocc's professor of stage acting and his mentor.
Biography.
Born in Ljubljana, Rocc studied opera stage directing at the <a href="Jan%C3%A1%C4%8Dek%20Academy%20of%20Music%20and%20Performing%20Arts">Janáček Academy of Music and Performing Arts in Brno</a> (1998–2003, Master of Arts), followed up by postgraduate studies of stage design at the <a href="Zurich%20University%20of%20the%20Arts">Hochschule für Gestaltung und Kunst in Zurich</a> (2003–2005, Executive Master), and with at the <a href="Hochschule%20f%C3%BCr%20Gestaltung%20Offenbach">Hochschule für Gestaltung in Offenbach am Main</a> (2005–2006, Certificate). He was granted a scholarship by the Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Slovenia, as well as receiving support from the <a href="Slovenian%20Academy%20of%20Sciences%20and%20Arts">Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts</a>.
Rocc has staged opera productions in the National Operas in <a href="National%20Theatre%20%28Prague%29">Prague</a>, <a href="National%20Theatre%20Brno">Brno</a>, <a href="Anton%C3%ADn%20Dvo%C5%99%C3%A1k%20Theatre">Ostrava</a>, <a href="Slovenian%20National%20Opera%20and%20Ballet%20Theatre">Ljubljana</a>, <a href="Latvian%20National%20Opera">Riga</a>, <a href="Wroc%C5%82aw%20Opera">Wrocław Opera</a>, Opera Bergen and elsewhere. His projects have been presented within several international festivals, e.g. <a href="Ljubljana%20Summer%20Festival">Ljubljana Festival</a>, Janáček Brno Festival, , OPERA Festival in Prague, <a href="Prague%20Quadrennial">Prague Quadrennial</a>, <a href="Warsaw%20Autumn">Warsaw Autumn Festival of Contemporary Music</a>, Festival of Sacred Music in Pordenone, <a href="ISCM%20World%20Music%20Days">ISCM World Music Days</a>, <a href="Bergen%20International%20Festival">Bergen International Festival</a>, Audio Art Festival in Kraków. Rocc has a special affinity for contemporary opera combining alternative sound, performing and installation arts, new media and site-specific projects. Since 2013 he has been the initiator and Artistic Director of Concept operapovera, an ensemble focused on contemporary and experimental music-theatre aesthetics.
In the 2007/2008 season Rocc held the post of <a href="Dramaturge">Dramaturge</a> of the <a href="Maribor%20Slovene%20National%20Theatre">Slovenian National Opera in Maribor</a>. The 2008/2009 season saw him as Deputy Artistic Director and Dramaturge of the Janáček Opera of the <a href="National%20Theatre%20Brno">National Theatre Brno</a>, in 2009–2011 he was Artistic Director of the Janáček Opera and a member of the Programme Board of the International Janáček Brno Festival. In 2011–2013 he was Artistic Director of the <a href="State%20Opera%20%28Prague%29">Prague State Opera</a>, which is from 2012 affiliated with the <a href="National%20Theatre%20%28Prague%29">National Opera in Prague</a>. In 2013–2019 he was Artistic Director of the <a href="Ljubljana%20Slovene%20National%20Theatre%20Opera%20and%20Ballet">Slovenian National Opera</a> in his hometown Ljubljana.
Rocc works as <a href="Docent">Docent</a> of opera acting at the <a href="Academy%20of%20Music%20%28Ljubljana%29">Academy of Music in Ljubljana</a> and he has been a member of professional juries at international singing competitions.
